a wave shawl to create a stylish easy to knit easy to wear cowl in fingering weight yarn pattern requirements sizes one size however the size is easily adjustable by adding or removing multiples of 6 sts sample shown has 26 repeats of the chart per round and 11 repeats of the 12 round chart plus ribbing measurements length 38 cm 15 in and circumference 57 cm 22 5 in yarn 100g of any 4ply/fingering weight yarn sample was knitted using schachenmayr regia premium merino silk in shade 0051 silber blau needles 3 mm / us or size needed to get gauge 60 cm 24 inch circular needle gauge 30 sts x 40 rnds in 10 cm 4 in in lace pattern notes to get the maximum number of repeats from 100g of 4ply yarn we recommend weighing your yarn before you cast on after the rib section and again after one repeat of the pattern abbreviations bor beginning of round we would love to see your crest of a wave k knit cowls m marker p purl please use #crestofawavecowl and tag us pm place marker @twinsetandpurl rm bor marker work in k2 p2 rib for 12 rnds follow either the written or the charted instructions below for the crest of a wave lace pattern the 6 st pattern repeat is worked 26 times per round work the 12 round pattern 11 times in total or until desired length ending after round 12 work in k2 p2 rib for 12 rnds cast off loosely in rib weave in ends and block to final measurements written
